meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of an actor.
meanings.sent1: Her actorish gestures on stage were quite dramatic.
meanings.sent2: The actress had an actorish presence that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but feel a bit actorish when practicing his lines in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent4: The way she commanded the room was truly actorish, like a seasoned performer.
meanings.sent5: The actorish mannerisms of the lead role made the character unforgettable.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a manner typical of an actor.
meanings.sent1: His actorish way of speaking made him stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent2: She had an actorish habit of using exaggerated expressions in everyday conversations.
meanings.sent3: The dog's actorish attempt at begging for treats was both adorable and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises seemed a bit too actorish to be genuine.
meanings.sent5: The child's actorish tantrum over not getting a toy was quite the performance.
